extendedEffectDescription: If your opponent uses a magic lightning card you may summon this card from your hand to the field as a Limited Summon. If at any point the player who currently controls this card does not have a primary creature on the field this card is sent to the cemetery. This card cannot be a primary summoned creature. This card is not removed from the field during standard primary creature sacrificing.

Equip this card to one of your opponents creatures on the field. While this card is equipped to a creature the primary creature under the same control as the equipped creature takes 10 damage each time the controlling player draws a card.

flavorText: Acolytes are priests in training at the Citadel of Dawn in High Rock. They serve the Holy Order as healers.
extendedEffectDescription: Prior to drawing a card during your draw phase heal this card for 5 points of health.

flavorText: Alknosts are created when harpies steal the remaining light from other Harpies. This is a vain attempt to regain a semblance of their former glory as Angels.
extendedEffectDescription: Once per turn cycle you may summon a Harpy or Alkonost from our hand or deck as a limited summon. If the Alkonost that summoned them to the field through its effect is killed or removed from the field they are not removed from the field as well. For each Harpy or Alkonost on the field, other than your primary creature, increase the primary creature's Attack dice by +1 and its Hit/Attack modifier by +1.

Equip this card to a creature on the field. Add the opposing players primary creatures Attack Dice rolls and Hit/Attack Modifier to the equipped creature. This card cannot be used with other “All in One” Magic cards. This effect only applies to the base stats of the opposing creatures.

While in the combat phase you may play this card from your hand. Summon a creature from your hand at no sacrificing cost as a limited summon to the field until the end of your turn. At the end of your turn return this card to your hand.
Increase the Attack of your primary creatures attack modifier by 2. This card is a field card and remains on the field until destroyed.

flavorText: A byproduct during the creation of the physical universe.This entity relishes in corrupting mortals, and forcing them into worshiping it. It feeds on the negative emotions from the mortal soul.
extendedEffectDescription: While this card is on the field and during your opponent's turn, if they control any limited summons, your opponent must initiate battle with each of their limited summons against their primary creature. This battle should be treated as any other battle between 2 creatures from opposing opponents. All normal combat rules apply. Magic cards can be played during this time.

While this card is on the field all players must roll a die. If the result of all the dice rolled match then all primary creatures on the field take 100hp damage. The player whose turn it currently is may choose when to have everyone roll for this effect during their turn.

While this card is on the field all creatures on both sides of the field that have an Armor Level of 6 or less and have no card effect have +1 Attack Dice Rolls. Creatures that have a summoning requirement are not considered Effect creatures.

flavorText: A young dinosaur. These creatures are still very aggressive and often hunt down dragonlings to eat.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A
Increase the Attack and Hit modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 2 each. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

flavorText: This creature is as fast as it is strong and is often mistaken for a werebear. However, this creature shares no love for its lycanthrope cousin.
extendedEffectDescription: This creature always attacks first during battle. This effect works independent of the speed stat.

flavorText: These small aquatic rodents are not strong predators. However, what they lack in strength they make up for in their incredible ability to build.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: These majestic creatures roam the forests of Ward. They are mostly timid, but can be incredibly aggressive during the rut. During the hunting season, they vanish!!
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

This card can only be equipped to a creature that currently has 9 or less remaining health points. Once equipped, heal the equipped creature 30 health points. While equipped, the equipped creature has its Hit and Attack Roll results doubled.

flavorText: Though not very strong, the Black Jacket hornet carries a devastating toxin in its body that can kill even the strongest creatures.
extendedEffectDescription: If the creature card “Hive Lord” is on your side of the field this card can be summoned directly from your hand to the field as a Limited Summon. Return this card to the original owner’s hand if “Hive Lord” leaves the field or changes control. This is considered a Summoning Requirement and black Jacket is considered a Non-Effect creature while on the field.
Equip this card to 1 creature on the field. If this card is removed from the field it explodes and deals 30hp of damage to the equipped creature.

This card is a field card and affects all players. While this card is on the field players cannot remove cards from their cemetery. Cards such as Holy Light or Frog of Fortune can still be played but their effect would not do anything.

flavorText: When the Bronto walks, the earth shakes with the sounds of thunder across the plains. They use their whip-like tail to fend off predators.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: This creature was created by the Westward Trading Company in Buck City. He was created to sell to the highest bidder as a weapon.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A
This card is a field card and affects all players. While this card is on the field, creatures that are “Bug” type creatures take 2x damage.
Increase the Armor Level, Speed, Attack Modifier, and Hit Modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 2 each. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

flavorText: The Bunnysaurus is one of the lesser-known dinosaurs of Ward. Its exceptionally large ears can alert them of danger from miles away.
extendedEffectDescription: While this card is on the field you may choose to negate an attack against this card, or negate the activation of a magic. This effect can only be used one time while this card is on the field.

flavorText: Captain Ward is the embodiment of the planet Ward. He was created through the wishes of a cult of young humans to clean the garbage of the Order and Cabal. “Time to take out the trash”. -Captain Ward
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

Increase the Speed, Attack Modifier, and Hit Modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 8 each. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time. This card cannot be negated during its activation. This card may be destroyed once on the field.

The equipped creature grows claws for 1 turn cycle. The equipped creature gains 2 additional Attack dice rolls. If the creature this card is equipped to also has “Wings of the Beast” equipped to it, then the equipped creature gains 3 additional Attack dice rolls instead of the previously mentioned 2 Attack dice rolls. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.
Increase the Armor Level stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 3. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.
Increase the Speed stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 3. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.
Increase the Hit Modifier stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 3. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.
Increase the Attack Modifier stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 3. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.
Increase the Attack Modifier stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 4. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

flavorText: Deep in the heart of the Ward Farmlands lays a creature that feeds on unsuspecting farmers. This creature emerges from its slumber every 32 years to feed. It has become a scary story that farmers tell their children to keep them from the crop.
extendedEffectDescription: This card does 5x damage for its first battle it is involved in where it attacks. This effect can only occur one time. If this card misses during its Hit rolls the 5x multiplier is not carried over to the next time this card either attacks or rebuttals.

Increase the Attack Modifier and Hit Modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 6 each. Add 2 additional dice to the Hit and Attack dice rolls of the creature in which this card is equipped. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time. This card cannot be negated during its activation. This card may be destroyed once on the field.
Anytime once battle has been initiated you may play this card. Roll 2 dice and heal one creature on the field the result of the dice.

flavorText: Dark Elf Captains make up the true strength of the Dark Elf armies. These ruthless leaders lead through fear and brutality.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

Play this card to the field. After being activated you may summon all the creatures from your hand to the field as limited summons. After one turn cycle, return all creatures back to your hand. The total number of creatures on the field cannot exceed 5 total creatures.

flavorText: These dragons were corrupted by the Demon King during the First Demonic invasion. They now breathe hell fire that is deadly to even Red Dragons.
extendedEffectDescription: For every card in your opponent's hand add +1 Attack dice Roll and +1 Modifier. (Modifier counts towards both your Attack and Hit rolls). This effect counts towards all opponents cards when playing games other than 1v1.

flavorText: These corrupted beasts were used to help replenish the ranks of the Demon Army after it took significant losses during the Second Demonic Invasion.
extendedEffectDescription: If this card has a lower Speed stat than the attacking player's primary creature, reduce all attack damage this card receives by ½. Inflict the reduced damage back on the attacking creature. The reflected damage is still applied in the event this card dies during the attack. Reflected damage cannot be blocked or reduced. Damage reflected by this card is only applicable to combat damage and does not include damage that comes from other sources such as: Damage from magic cards, Damage over time effects, other damage reflecting effects, ect.

Equip this card to a creature on the field. The equipped creature can initiate battle twice during this turn. The attacked player may only rebuttal with their attacked creature for 1 of the 2 battles it was involved in, they may choose which. If the creature who has Double Hit equipped kills the primary creature on the first attack. When the opposing player plays a new creature to the field the creature which Double Hit equipped may attack again. Double Hit cards may be equipped to the same creature in the same turn, however they do not allow for additional attacks.

flavorText: The Dwarves are clever engineers and stout warriors. Dwarf soldiers spend most of their lives battling Kobolds in the Under-Mountain tunnels and chasms.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: Electro Wizards are the rival of the Inferno Wizards. Electro Wizards believe the power of lightning is superior to that of flames. “The might of the body is the might of the mind.”-Grand master Voltarian Thunder Weaver
extendedEffectDescription: If this card does not battle on your turn, you may add +4 Attack Dice Rolls during your next turn. If you do not attack on multiple of your turns this effect does not gain additional Attack dice other than the initial +4 from the first skipped turn.

flavorText: When The Creator arrived on Ward, a loon was struck by cosmic lightning. It is now worshiped as a god by the primitive loons of the northern lakes.
extendedEffectDescription: All creatures on the opposing side of the field are stunned and cannot battle, or return attack. At the beginning of your opponent(s) turn they may roll a die. If the result is 1-2 this effect ends. This effect is not creature specific and can persist through your opponent summoning new creatures to the field.

flavorText: Elite Angels are the shock troopers for the Army of Light. Following the 1st Demonic Invasion the Elite Angels were tasked with the defense of the Citadel of Agony.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A
Increase the Attack Modifier stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 6. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

flavorText: A human soldier who lost his equipment to drinking and gambling. Sometimes the equipment does make the difference.
extendedEffectDescription: On summon, you may search your deck for 1 magic card that says “equip” on the card. Equip that card to this creature and then shuffle your deck.
Destroy 1 magic card on the field.
Do 2x damage to all creatures on the field with either “Demon” in their name or are a demon type creature.

flavorText: During the reign of the Empire of the Damned, there were many who were raised into undeath after battle. These crusaders proved to be both capable of holy rite in life, and terrible necrotic horror in death.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A
For 3 turn cycles only creature and magic cards that are equip cards can be played/used. Cards such as lightning, standard, and Field cards are examples of cards that cannot be used during this time.

flavorText: This creature was once the ruler of Ward. After a mighty battle with The Old God, it was cast out and soon became nothing more than ancient legend. Some obscure cultists still speak of its return one day.
extendedEffectDescription: Add +1 to both the Attack and Hit Modifier for each point this card has in its Speed stat over 12. This includes any increase to its speed from magic cards or other creature effects. Example: The magic card “Mounted Assault” is equipped to Forgotten One. This adds +6 to the Speed stat of The Forgotten One. This would bring the total stat of The Forgotten one up to 16, making the modifier +4.

This card affects all players on the field. While this card is on the field the player must declare battle with all the creatures currently under their control during their turn. If the player is unable to declare battle for any reason with any of the creatures, Frenzy is destroyed.
Play this card to the field. Discard a creature in your hand for a creature in your cemetery. Place the returned creature from the cemetery in your hand.
This card affects all creatures on the field with “Were” in their name. Add +1 Hit Dice, +1 Attack Dice, and add +5 Armor to each creature affected by this card.

Equip this card to a creature. The player may choose to negate the damage the equipped creature receives while this card is equipped. This card is sent to the cemetery after this card has negated the damage.
Equip this card to a creature. The equipped creature cannot be damaged for 2 turn cycles. This card can still be hit and affected by creatures' effects.

flavorText: Although not venomous, these large snakes are still extremely dangerous. They use their immense size to attack creatures and suffocate them to death.
extendedEffectDescription: When this card hits a target creature, the target creature is wrapped. The wrapped creature cannot battle or return attack while they are wrapped. Once per turn, the wrapped opponent may roll 1 die. If the result is 3-6, the wrap effect ends.

flavorText: Although not known for their military prowess, Gnomes have found clever ways to carve out their place in the brutal world of Ward.
extendedEffectDescription: For every card in your hand with “Gnome” in its name add an extra Attack dice and +1 to the Hit and Attack Modifier. Prior to making your attack you must show all “Gnome” cards in your hand to your opponent(s).

flavorText: Gnomish warriors are not very strong, but they make up for it with speed and dexterity. They use their small size to dash around many of the larger creatures of Ward. They tend to aim for the soft flesh and ligaments.
extendedEffectDescription: For every card in your hand with “Gnome” in its name add an extra Attack dice and +1 to the Hit and Attack Modifier. Prior to making your attack you must show all “Gnome” cards in your hand to your opponent(s).

flavorText: If a Sharkling eats enough it will grow into this terrifying killing machine. The Great White has been known to bite through wood and even steel. Nothing can prepare a man for the lifeless, doll eyes of this monster.
extendedEffectDescription: This creature has additional requirements to summon this creature to the field under normal summoning conditions. This creature can only be summoned to the field by having “Sharkling” on the field and placing this creature on top of “Sharkling”. This creature cannot be summoned in the same turn as “Sharkling” as a typical sacrifice card may work. If this card is removed from the field, changes control, or is destroyed, all “Sharkling”, “Great White”, and “Perfect Shark” cards placed underneath this card follow this card as if they were one single card. This card may be summoned to the field via magic cards or creature effects. This creature does not have an effect and is considered a "Non-Effect creature".

flavorText: The Green Dragons were once Swamp Dragons. They left the marches and swamps  of Ward for a life in the fields where larger game roamed. This has caused them to lose their innate immunity to poisons but has allowed them to grow larger in size.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

Both you and your opponent may look at the top 5 cards of your opponents deck. You may rearrange those 5 cards in any order. Once finished rearranging those cards, place them back on the top of your opponent's deck. Do not shuffle their deck.
Play this card from your hand when your opponent plays/activates a magic card from their hand. Negate the activation/playing of that magic card and send it to your opponents cemetery.

flavorText: This knight was beheaded in battle during the Empire of Man. He was brought into undeath by the Undead King himself, but managed to keep his hatred for the dead. He now rides at night killing undead with a horrible, maniacal laugh.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

Play this card from your hand when your opponent plays/activates a lightning magic card. Take away half of the remaining HP of the primary creature of the player who used the lightning magic card. This card cannot be negated on activation by magic cards or creature effects.
During your turn, roll one die to heal a target creature. If the result of the dice roll is 1-3 heal 10 HP, 4-5 heal 20 HP, and if the result is a 6 heal 30 HP.

Play this card from your hand when your opponent summons a creature to the field. The summoned creature is frozen and cannot battle, rebuttal, or be sacrificed. During your opponent's turn they may roll a dice to unfreeze themselves. If the result of the roll is 5-6 unfreeze the targeted/frozen creature and send this card to the cemetery. This card remains on the field as an infinite magic card while this effect is in effect. If this card is destroyed by a creature effect or magic card end this card's effect on the targeted creature.
During your turn, roll one die to damage a target creature. If the result of the dice roll is 1-5 inflict 10 HP damage. If the result is 6, inflict 20 HP damage.
During your turn, roll one die to damage a target creature. If the result of the dice roll is 1-5 inflict 20 HP damage. If the result is 6, inflict 40 HP damage.
During your turn, roll one die to damage a target creature. If the result of the dice roll is 1-5 inflict 15 HP damage. If the result is 6, inflict 30 HP damage.

flavorText: The Inferno Wizards are an order of spell casters that do not choose mind over body, but mind AND body. “For a strength of the mind, requires strength of the body.” -Grand Master Magnus Blaze
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

While this card is on the field your opponent cannot cause damage to any creatures, or play magic cards from their hand. Magic cards on your opponent's side of the field that are already on the field are not negated or destroyed and their effects are still able to function normally unless they are causing damage. During your opponents turn they may roll 1 dice. If the result is 1-3 the effect of this card ends and this card is sent to the cemetery.

flavorText: Jerry is a creature from Caois, the dimension of chaos. He is not evil, but has a habit of morphing himself into others around him. He was banished from his realm for being annoying. He now spends his time around Ward, annoying EVERYONE!!!
extendedEffectDescription: This creature copies the base stats of your opponent’s primary creature. Jerry’s morphing ability does not copy buffs, other magic cards, or creature effects that are affecting the opponent's creature. If a new primary creature enters the field jerry immediately changes his stats to reflect the base stats of the new primary creature. Copied stats include: Armor Level, Speed, Attack Dice, Attack/Hit Modifier, and creature type. If for any reason Jerry cannot copy another creature's stats he uses his own stats.

flavorText: The Kendo Tiger was once madly in love with a Baree Lioness. She showed no affection towards him. This caused him to leave their tribe. He now lives amongst the primitive felines of Ward and teaches them the art of masculinity.
extendedEffectDescription: When this creature is summoned to the field you may choose 1 of the two effects to occur. First: Send 1 card from your opponent’s hand back to their deck. Your opponent must then shuffle their deck. Second: You may destroy 1 magic card on the field.
Increase the Hit Modifier and Armor Level stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 2 each. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

This card can only be equipped to a primary creature. Once equipped the equipped creature cannot leave the field or change possession other than death by battle, or damage. This card cannot be removed from the field unless destroyed.

Increase the Attack Modifier and Armor Level stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 6 each. Additionally, the equipped creature also gains 1 additional dice roll to their Hit dice rolls.
Increase the Speed, Hit Modifier, and Attack Modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 6 each.
Increase the Speed and Armor Level stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 6 each. Additionally, the equipped creature also gains 1 additional dice roll to their Attack dice rolls.

Equip this card to 1 of your opponents creatures. Whenever your opponent who owns the card Life Sap is equipped to draws a card, the equipped creature takes 5 HP damage and your primary creature heals 5 HP damage.
Play this card when your opponent activates/plays a magic card from their hand. Negate and send to the cemetery the activated/played magic card and deal 30 HP damage to all creatures on the field.

This card is an infinite field card and remains on the field until destroyed. At the beginning of your turn (Prior to ending your first magic/summoning phase) you may roll 1 die. If the result of that die is a 6 your opponent(s) must discard 1 magic card from their hand. If the result of the dice roll is a 1 destroy this card.
Destroy all magic cards on your opponents side of the field. This includes all opposing players.

Block/negate the effect of the next magic card that targets the equipped creature. Once this card has successfully blocked/negated the magic card in question, send the blocked/negated magic card, and this card to the cemetery. If a magic card cannot be negated, such as “Creator’s Gift”, this card remains on the equipped creature and unused.
The equipped creature may re-roll either their Hit or Attack Dice roll once per battle.

flavorText: Legend states this creature once was a man cursed by The Old god for refusing to give up his trophy buck as a tribute of worship. He is now forced to hunt for all time as a hideous version of an Owl.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: This man was once considered the strongest knight in the Empire of Man’s northern regions. He went mad when local villagers burned his sister for witchcraft. He now roams the northern forests killing all who live there.
extendedEffectDescription: This creature's effect affects how Hitting your opponents creature functions. This creature critically hits (2x dmg) if the base result of the Hit Dice, excluding modifiers, is an 8-12. If the result of the Hit Dice roll is a 1-7 this creature misses. If the total result of the Hit Dice is greater than 12 apply normal battle conditions for hitting the target creature. This creature cannot critically miss (roll a die against yourself). This creature is unaffected by Hit Modifier increases, this does not include additional Hit Dice. See rules guide for further information on Critical Hits and Critical misses.

When you land a hit, play this card from your hand. Add +20 damage to the end of your Attack Dice rolls. This card is not considered part of the creature's attack. This card acts as a separate set of additional damage added after the attack damage has concluded, but still within the battle and combat phase.

Play this card from your hand when your opponent activates a magic card or lands a hit. If negating a magic card: Negate the magic cards activation and send it to your opponents cemetery. If negating the attack: Negate/block the attack. The attacking creature hits this card instead of the intended target.

The equipped creature gains the following stat buffs based on the current AL (including any AL increases from magic cards or creature effects) of the target the equipped creature is battling. When battling creatures with an Armor Level of 7-11 add +3 Attack Dice Rolls to your creature during battle. When battling creatures with an Armor Level of 12 add +3 Attack Dice Rolls to your creature during battle. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

The equipped creature cannot receive damage. During you opponents turn they may roll 1 die. If the result is 1-3, this card is destroyed. The equipped creature can still be affected by creature effects based on the equipped creature being hit. However, this does not supersede the ability for the equipped creatures ability to not take damage. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

flavorText: this creature came from another reality that was destroyed. Metamoth now lives in the dark forests of Ward trying to adjust to a new world. For some reason, The Creator allowed this creature to live on in his universe.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: these beautiful creatures were brought from the moon to Ward by the Eternal Titan. The Eternal Titan blessed these felines and tasked them with hunting and eradicating all those afflicted by the Lycanthropy disease.
extendedEffectDescription: This card does double damage to any creature with “Were” in its name. It also receives the effects of the magic card “Full Moon” as if it were a “Were” creature.

Increase the Hit and Attack Modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 7 each. This card can only be equipped to Non-effect creatures with an Armor Level of 5 or less. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time. (Creatures that have effects but are currently a limited summon, or a primary creature whose effect is currently being negated or nullified, are still considered “Effect creatures” and are not eligible to have this card equipped to them).
Increase the Attack Dice Roll stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 1. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.
Play this card to the field and you may trade 1 creature in your hand for 1 creature in your cemetery. Send this card to the cemetery after this card's effect has been resolved.

flavorText: Penguins are not aggressive creatures by nature. They roam in large rookeries where they huddle together for warmth and safety as they travel the colder regions of Ward.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: Deep in the oceans of Ward there live a humanoid race of sharks that evolved alongside man. They are incredibly intelligent, and still retain all their terrifying shark strength.
extendedEffectDescription: This creature has additional requirements to summon this creature to the field under normal summoning conditions. This creature can only be summoned to the field by having “Sharkling” and “Great White” on the field and placing this creature on top of “Sharkling” and “Great White”. This creature cannot be summoned in the same turn as “Sharkling” and “Great White” as a typical sacrifice card may work. If this card is removed from the field, changes control, or is destroyed, all “Sharkling”, “Great White”, and “Perfect Shark” cards placed underneath this card follow this card as if they were one single card. This card may be summoned to the field via magic cards or creature effects. This card may be summoned to the field via magic cards or creature effects. This creature does not have an effect and is considered a "Non-Effect creature".

The equipped creature takes 10 fire damage at the beginning of their turn(s) (After Phase 1: Draw phase and prior to Phase 2: Magic/Summoning). If the equipped creature is killed, the equipped creature remains on the field and sends this card to the cemetery instead.  After sending this card to the cemetery restore the equipped creature's Health Points back to 50% of its current max HP. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

Play this card from your hand when your opponent intends to heal their creature. Negate the healing effect on their creature and instead the creature targeted to be healed instead takes the amount intended to heal as damage. This works with percentage heals as well. In this event determine the total numerical number that would have been healed and deal that amount as damage.

flavorText: Raccoons are small woodland creatures who often venture into civilization and steal food from trash containers.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: One night while rummaging for food, an Iron Range raccoon saw a piece of cheese stuck to the handle of a sword in a stone. It pulled with all its might, and removed the sword from the stone it was lodged in. The Raccoon Knight was born.
extendedEffectDescription: This creature has additional requirements to summon this creature to the field under normal summoning conditions. This creature requires not sacrifices to summon to the field. This card may be summoned to the field via magic cards or creature effects. This creature does not have an effect and is considered a "Non-Effect creature".
If the equipped creature is damaged in battle, inflict 5 Health Points of damage back at the attacking creature. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

Play this card to the field. Once this card has been played to the field, immediately send it to your cemetery. If this card was not negated during activation and was successfully played, this card reduces your overall cemetery Health Points by 30.

This card affects all creatures on the field. While this card is on the field the creature with the slower Speed stat attacks first during battle. If the Speed stats are equal, roll a die and the higher number attacks first. Creatures that are unaffected by magic cards such as Steam Rex and Ent Tree are unaffected by this card's effect. During battle with these such creatures, use standard speed stat rules to determine who attacks first during that battle.

This card affects how Hitting your opponents creature functions. The equipped creature's Hit Dice rolls are replaced with the following results: The equipped creature critically hits (2x dmg) if the base result of the Hit Dice, excluding modifiers, is a 9-12. If the result of the Hit Dice roll is a 1-8 the equipped creature critically misses (Snakes Eyes) and must roll 1 dice against themselves. If the total result of the Hit Dice is greater than 12 apply normal battle conditions for hitting the target creature. The equipped creature is unaffected by Hit Modifier and HIt Dice  increases. See rules guide for further information on Critical Hits and Critical misses.

flavorText: Why the goat has been chosen as the animal of sacrifices is beyond anyone’s memory. All we know is these poor creatures can’t seem to catch a break.
extendedEffectDescription: When this creature is used as a sacrifice for summoning this creature is counted as 2 creature sacrifices. This creature must be on the field for this effect to take place. If this card is sacrificed from your hand this card only counts as 1 sacrificed creature.
Play this card when your opponent activates/plays a lightning magic card from their hand. Negate the lightning card they played and send it to their cemetery. This card cannot be negated.

flavorText: Sharklings spend their days hunting small fish in the shallow reefs. They can still be very dangerous to unsuspecting swimmers.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: Skeleton Lords are more than a shambling pile of bones. They continue the Undead King’s will, leading large groups of zombies and ghouls in his absence.
extendedEffectDescription: When this card is summoned to the field, take control of your opponent's most recent creature sent to their cemetery as a limited summon. Return the summoned creature back to your opponent's cemetery if this card leaves the field, changes control, or this effect is negated.

flavorText: YYYAARRRGGG! This skeleton were a scurvy, swash buckling, career buccaneer spending his life pillaging and plundering. Now in death he…..pillages and plunders.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

Equip this card to 1 creature on the field. The equipped creature is put to sleep for 2 turn cycles. While asleep the sleeping creature cannot initiate battle, but also heals 10 Health Points per turn cycle. Any damage the equipped creature receives wakes the sleeping creature and sends this card to the cemetery. This card is sent to the cemetery after the 2nd turn cycle has concluded of being equipped to the targeted creature.

flavorText: In the farthest north reaches of Ward lived a tribe of nomad humans. These humans stayed warm by burying themselves in snow. As years passed, their human bodies fused into the snow they used for heat. They are now known as the Snow Men.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

Equip this card to 1 creature on the field. The equipped creature is dazed and prior to initiating battle or rebuttaling during battle the equipped creature must roll a die. If the result is 1-2 the equipped creature is no longer dazed and this card is destroyed. If they do not roll 1-2 then the equipped creature takes 5 damage and still cannot battle or rebuttal.

flavorText: The Spino spends a large amount of its time in lakes and rivers fishing for food. They will occasionally fight with the T-Rex and other large creatures over territory.
extendedEffectDescription: This creature does 2x damage to any creature that is near or in water in its card art image, or has “Near Water” listed in its other attributes in the cards extended card description.

flavorText: these small creatures may not be strong, but they are incredibly agile. Dogs and other canines will spend hours of their lives at the base of a tree waiting for them to come down, but they never will.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: After the 2nd Demonic Invasion, the dwarves realized that the mortals of Ward were hilariously outmatched. They create this mechanical terror to protect Ward from cosmic entities.
extendedEffectDescription: this creature is unaffected by creature effects and magic cards. This creature does 2x damage to any creature with a current Armor Level of 12 (including magic card and creature effect increases).

flavorText: The Steam Rex was created by the dwarves for the Empire of Man. It was intended to be a gift for the humans to earn their favor. However, the monstrous war machine never functioned correctly and could barely follow orders.
extendedEffectDescription: This creature is unaffected by creature effects and magic card effects. This only applies to creature effects or magic card effects that apply to this creature. Additionally, if your opponent plays a lightning card, double this creature's battle damage during the turn in which the lightning card was played. This effect must occur prior to this card battling the turn the lightning card was played to receive the 2x damage multiplier.

flavorText: This mechanical monstrosity was created by the dwarves to assist in mining operations. Although not a war machine, it can double as an armored vehicle.
extendedEffectDescription: This creature cannot be removed from the field unless destroyed. It cannot be used as a sacrifice from the field. This creature cannot change control.

flavorText: These creatures were the result of early experiments by the Westward Trading Company. They began by mixing creatures of the wild with mechanical parts powered by steam engines. They had issues with rust and were discarded.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

Play this card from your hand when your opponent lands a hit. Negate/block the attack and reduce the attacking creature's modifier to +0 for 1 turn cycle. The attacking creature hits this card instead of the intended target.

flavorText: this monster was once a brilliant alchemist. During his research, the Westward Trading Company attempted to silence him by injecting experimental potions into his body. The company then locked him away in their laboratory, deep under Buck City.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: A failed experiment on a wild Pumpkin Man that escaped from its creators. It has become a local folktale that farmers tell their children late at night and around campfires.
extendedEffectDescription: This creature has additional summoning requirements alongside its standard summoning requirements. If the creature card “Pumpkin Man” is used as a sacrifice for this creature “Pumpkin Man” acts as 2 sacrifices for this creature. This card may be summoned to the field via magic cards or creature effects. This creature does not have an effect and is considered a "Non-Effect creature".

flavorText: summoners are wizards who flunked out of the Grand Academy. Offensive magic is not their forte. However, they excel at ripping open holes in space-time to unleash beings from other times and dimensions to fight for them.
extendedEffectDescription: During your turn, roll two dice. You may summon a creature from your hand with an Armor Level less than or equal to the result of the dice roll as a limited summon. Send the summoned creature back to your hand at the end of your turn.

flavorText: This creature is the product of the Hive Lord attempting to create a wife from a giant hornet. The project was a failure and the Super hornet was born, but it was a male, and preferred a life of crime fighting rather than love.
extendedEffectDescription: This creature can be summoned as normal. If the creature card “Hive Lord” is on your side of the field this card can be summoned directly from your hand to the field as a Limited Summon. Return this card to the original owner’s hand if “Hive Lord” leaves the field or changes control. This is considered a Summoning Requirement and therefore super Hornet is considered a Non-Effect creature while on the field.

flavorText: Alchemists believe in the power of pseudo-science. To them magic is not some arcane mystery, but a scientific discovery waiting to be solved.
extendedEffectDescription: During your turn roll 1 die. If the result is… -(1-2) Heal this creature 5 Health Points -(3-4) Deal 10 damage to your opponent's creature. -(5-6) Deal 5 Health Points damage to this card.
Increase the Hit and Attack Modifier stats of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 6 each for 1 turn cycle. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.
The equipped creature receives a +1 to their Hit and Attack Modifier for every card in your opponent's hand. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

flavorText: The Guides are a collection of otherworldly beings who guide the souls of the dead to their final resting place. The color of the flame is linked to the deeds of the soul’s mortal life. The color determines which realm to bring the souls.
extendedEffectDescription: When a creature is sent to the cemetery for any reason, heal this creature for half of the total Health Points of the creature sent to the cemetery.

This card affects all creatures on the field. This card negates all creature effects on the field. Creatures that have their effects negated due to this cards effect are still considered effect creatures. Creatures that are unaffected by magic cards such as Steam Rex and Ent Tree are unaffected by this card's effect. Creatures such as these retain their effects.

flavorText: When the Old God came to Ward, he didn't realize there was already a creature ruling the seas. The Old One manifested at the same time as the old god in the universe.
extendedEffectDescription: When summoned, return all cards (Aside from this card) on the field back to their original owner’s decks. All players who sent cards back to their decks then shuffle their decks and draw the same number of cards they sent back to their decks

flavorText: These creatures have evolved to have eyes all over their body. It allows them to see 360 degrees to aid in hunting and hiding from prey and predators. They are rumored to be spawns of an ancient creature who was locked away long ago.
extendedEffectDescription: While this card is on the field all players on the opposing side of the field must play with their cards in their hand(s) face up on the table

flavorText: Common throughout Ward, thieves are the scourge of the civilized world. These individuals seem to act randomly. However, these random acts go much deeper to an underground organized crime network.
extendedEffectDescription: When this card is summoned to the field, steal 1 equip magic card from your opponent’s side of the field and equip it to this card. When this card leaves the field, changes control, or if this effect is negated send the stolen card back to the original card owner's cemetery.
While this card is on the field, lighting cards cannot be played by any players.

flavorText: These spellcasters draw their power from an extinct creature. Although small in size, the raw power these beautiful women wield can rival even the strongest of foes.
extendedEffectDescription: While this card is on the field, lighting cards cannot be played by any players.

flavorText: A peaceful herbivore of the Ward primal era. The Trike will charge and impale unsuspecting adventures with its mighty horns.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: The master of undeath, enemy of the living, and once the king of a great human empire. The Undead King has set his eyes on an enemy far more dangerous than anything Ward has seen before. Behold a pale horse, and death followed with it.
extendedEffectDescription: During your turn, roll 1 die. If the result of that dice roll is a 4-6 you may summon a creature from your cemetery as a limited summon to your side of the field. Only limited summons summoned to the field by this effect, are sent to the cemetery if this card leaves the field, switches control, or this effect is negated.

flavorText: This towering abomination is the product of 1000s of corpses being fused together and brought to life. IT roams aimlessly throughout Ward without purpose. It destroys all in its path waiting for the return of its master and king.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

This card reduces the equipped creature's current Armor Level by 2. Example: Vampire Lord who has a base AL of 10 is equipped with a Common Armor magic card. This brings his AL to 12. Unicorn Might is then equipped, this would reduce Vampire Lords AL back to 10, regardless of the extra +1 received from the Common Armor. Additionally, if the order of operations was reversed and Unicorn Might is equipped, than Common Armor is equipped to Vampire Lord the result would be 10 base AL - 2 AL from Unicorn Might equaling 8 AL for Vampire Lord. Then Common Armor is equipped for +3 AL for a total of 11 AL for Vampire Lord.

flavorText: Vampire Lords may seem refined and sophisticated. However, behind their visage of refinement is nothing but a blood-drunk apex predator.
extendedEffectDescription: During your turn, you may send one creature from your hand to your cemetery. Heal the Vampire Lord 2x the amount of the total Heath Points of the creature sent to the cemetery via this effect.

flavorText: The remnants of a once powerful orcish clan who fell during the 2nd demonic invasion. The few surviving members pledged loyalty to a coven of vampires in exchange for the power to take revenge on all demons.
extendedEffectDescription: Add your opponents current primary creatures modifier to this card. This effect is not continuous and only matches the base stats of the opposing primary creature.
Increase the Hit Dice Roll stat of the creature in which this card is equipped to by 1. This card can be equipped to only 1 creature card at a time.

flavorText: The manifestation of living water being brought to life by the destruction of pollution of nearby water sources.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: The curse of Lycanthropy can take many forms. Werehawks come out at the full moon to hunt for prey with their razor-sharp talons and exquisite eyesight.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: These creatures were once great men who contracted Lycanthropy. Through their greed and hubris, they were instead changed into rat-like creatures. These once proud men now scavenge the filth and sewers of their cities.
extendedEffectDescription: N/A

flavorText: These undead monsters are the result of vampires that lose control of their blood lust. They are now more animal than man.
extendedEffectDescription: On hit, when this creature hits any creature on the field reduce that opponent’s primary creature’s Armor Levels to 0. Increase this card's modifier by the number of Armor Levels reduced. This effect ends and must be reapplied if the creature affected by this effect leaves the field, switches control, or this effect is negated.

Play this card from your hand when your opponent finishes their attack dice rolls. Negate the attack damage and freeze the attacking creature for 1 turn cycle. Frozen creatures cannot initiate battle, rebuttal, or be sacrificed.

flavorText: A traveling wizard was practicing his magic near a pond one day. Little did he know that a small portion of his arcane ability was absorbed by several small frogs. This gave them magical abilities, and a hat.
extendedEffectDescription: During your turn, you may send a card from your hand back to your deck, then shuffle your deck. Double the battle damage this card inflicts for this turn. This ability is not counted as a critical hit and would create a 4x multiplier if paired with a critical hit roll.

flavorText: These knights were once devout to the Empire of the Damned. They took on the power of the werewolves, but managed to keep their human mind. They turned on the undead, seeing them as weak.
extendedEffectDescription: During your turn, you may summon a creature with “Were” in its name from your hand as a limited summon. If this card leaves the field, changes control, or this effect is negated, return all creatures summoned by this effect back to your hand.

flavorText: Once man’s best friend, now man’s most feared predator. Zombie dogs are known to hunt the woods outside of buck city. They have a habit of bursting through windows, terrifying their prey before they kill.
extendedEffectDescription: If this creature attacks first during battle, do 3x attack damage during that battle.
